conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic field to calculate the time it takes to pass through point O downward again.
The image shows two uniform magnetic fields, B1 and B2, separated by line MN. A particle with charge +q and mass m enters B1 perpendicularly at point O.
The particle experiences a magnetic force F = qvB1 directed perpendicular to both v and B1.
The particle moves downward and will eventually reach the interface MN and enter the magnetic field B2.
At the interface, the magnetic force changes to F = qvB2.
The particle's motion is such that it will return to point O after passing through the magnetic field B2.
The time taken for the particle to pass through point O downward again is given by the time it takes to travel the distance 2d in the magnetic field B2.
The time is calculated using the equation for uniformly accelerated motion: t = sqrt(2md/qB2).
Given B1 = 2B2, the time is t = sqrt(2md/qB2) = sqrt(md/qB2).
Therefore, the time taken is sqrt(md/qB2).
